content: quote: WASHINGTON (CNN) -- The World Health Organization raised the influenza epidemic level from 4 to 5 on Wednesday, signalling that a pandemic is imminent, and urged countries to implement their pandemic plans. Now, either they know something they are sure as hell not telling us, or this is just gross exaggerations. Thousands die of the regular flue each year, so why is this such a big deal? Imagine a full blown pandemic on our hands...this is the last damn thing we need. All I know is i'm taking my ass down to home depot and grab some face masks....
quote: WASHINGTON (CNN) -- The World Health Organization raised the influenza epidemic level from 4 to 5 on Wednesday, signalling that a pandemic is imminent, and urged countries to implement their pandemic plans.

content: You know, there WAS some pandemic money in the original House stimulus, but some in the GOP thought it would be wasteful spending so it was cut...and then not a single one of them voted for it anyway. Shame, could have used that money. Fortunately we now have a President that thinks ahead and is already planning for a pandemic, whether or not it becomes one.

content: Yes - about 36K die each year in the US of flu-related causes, usually the elderly and of complications such as pneumonia. Globally, about a quarter to a million to a half million (yes MILLION) die each year from the flu or its complications. In THIS country (the US - I'm writing from elsewhere) a pandemic like this can be handled. We have enough anti-viral medication to take care of those who are infected. The problems lie in global travel and the open ports around the globe. In order to contain a pandemic, those holes need to be CLOSED for a finite period of time, and right now (the critical time) that's not happening that I know of. Please correct me if I'm wrong.
reply: Yes - about 36K die each year in the US of flu-related causes, usually the elderly and of complications such as pneumonia. Globally, about a quarter to a million to a half million (yes MILLION) die each year from the flu or its complications. In THIS country (the US - I'm writing from elsewhere) a pandemic like this can be handled. We have enough anti-viral medication to take care of those who are infected. The problems lie in global travel and the open ports around the globe. In order to contain a pandemic, those holes need to be CLOSED for a finite period of time, and right now (the critical time) that's not happening that I know of. Please correct me if I'm wrong.
